intro: Hieracium curvipes, commonly known as the bent-stem hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and hairy, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium curvipes is often found in open habitats and can form dense colonies, making it a notable species in ecological studies.
